title: __init__.py shows up in navigation on 1.44.1

labels.name: status:confirmed
labels.description: Bug has been confirmed by the Streamlit team

body:
### Checklist

- [x] I have searched the [existing issues](https://github.com/streamlit/streamlit/issues) for similar issues.
- [x] I added a very descriptive title to this issue.
- [x] I have provided sufficient information below to help reproduce this issue.

### Summary

Previously, `__init__.py` in `pages` would be invisible to autogenerated navigation. After an upgrade (and after testing with several versions), somewhere between `1.43.1` and `1.44.1`, this behavior changed and now there is a blank "init" page in the navbar. 

### Reproducible Code Example

```Python

```

### Steps To Reproduce

Can be reproduced by setting up a structure like so, and running `streamlit run mainpage.py` on 1.43.1 vs 1.44.1:

.
└── appname/
    ├── appname/
    │   ├── pages/
    │   │   ├── __init__.py
    │   │   ├── page1.py
    │   │   └── page2.py
    │   ├── mainpage.py
    │   └── __init__.py
    ├── README.md
    └── poetry.lock

### Expected Behavior

Expected that `__init__.py`/"init" should not be listed in pages.

### Current Behavior

1.43.1:

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/77711fee-f5b2-45f6-ac4c-458926b7d343)

1.44.1

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/e31b4f87-780b-4e2c-9642-f1a8e8b2a783)

### Is this a regression?

- [x] Yes, this used to work in a previous version.

### Debug info

- Streamlit version: 1.44.1
- Python version: 3.10.12
- Operating System: Ubuntu/Docker
- Browser: Edge


### Additional Information

_No response_
